column4: Uh, i just installed ubuntu yesterday and the color scheme seems a bit.. off
It's too dark/odd? Not sure if it's just displaying wrong
Have a look in System -> Preferences -> Appearance
changing between the themes doesn't really make a difference, still looks odd
Lets you select other themes. If they seem odd as well, you are more sure that there is an actual display problem
Ah, ok
Can you describe "odd"?
If i can take a screenshot, yes.
I think that it may very well look normal on other machines
yeah.
Which drivers? Proprietary or open source?
Just tried resetting my monitor and it got even odder
have you tried the open source ones?
No, i didn't know they existed.. and won't that leave me without hardware acceleration ?
They work very well on my laptop and since ATI has opened the specs, you *do* get accell :-)
In other words, I recommend that you try out the open source drivers, if for nothing else, to see if they have the same problem. If so, you might have a hardware problem on your hands...
Nonsense, it worked perfectly fine in windows (and still does) when i reboot.
Well, then set it right on that monitor?
trying :)
My concern is, though, that since you say that it works fine in Windows, that leaves us with the drivers as the likely culprit
Happy to help, if it was only just a little. I still don't think it would hurt to use the opens source drivers, though ;-)
